How to set up streaming on YouTube, Twitch or Instagram:

üì∫ YouTube:
  • Go to studio.youtube.com
  • Click on ‚ÄúGo live‚Äù
  • You will find:
    • RTMP URL: rtmp://a.rtmp.youtube.com/live2
    • Stream key: e.g. abcd-1234-xxxx-zzzz
  • Enter this: rtmp://a.rtmp.youtube.com/live2/abcd-1234-xxxx-zzzz
üéÆ Twitch:
  • Go to dashboard.twitch.tv
  • Menu > Settings > Stream
  • RTMP URL: rtmp://live.twitch.tv/app
  • Stream key: e.g. live_12543_...
  • Enter this: rtmp://live.twitch.tv/app/live_12543_...
The RTMP URL is encrypted and not visible to anyone.

To modify the score during the live stream, you need to generate a link before the match.

This link opens a web page where you can update the points of both teams in real time.

üîó It is recommended to share the link with only one trusted person to avoid simultaneous changes.

‚ö†Ô∏è Anyone with the link can change the scores, so do not share it publicly.
Spikestream allows you to live stream matches and manage the score in real time, so viewers can follow them from anywhere.
Log in or create a new account. After logging in, you will be redirected to your list of created matches.

Tap the button at the bottom of the match list. Enter the team names and the RTMP address where the match will be streamed. For Youtube, you can watch the YouTube tutorial to learn how to create an RTMP URL for the live stream.
Tap "Create match" to confirm. You will return to the dashboard with all your matches.

Open the match from the list. In the match screen you will find two buttons: - "Start streaming" to begin the broadcast. - "Generate Invite Link" to create a link to share with the person who will update the score (preferably just one person).
